problem_prompt:
Solve the following problem. When three positive integers are divided by $12$, the remainders are $7,$ $9,$ and $10,$ respectively.

When the sum of the three integers is divided by $12$, what is the remainder?
solution:
We can call the three integers in this problem $a,$ $b,$ and $c$. Then we have \begin{align*}
a &\equiv 7\pmod{12}, \\
b &\equiv 9\pmod{12}, \\
c &\equiv 10\pmod{12}.
\end{align*}Adding these congruences, we have \begin{align*}
a+b+c &\equiv 7+9+10 \\
&= 26\pmod{12}.
\end{align*}Therefore, $a+b+c$ has the same remainder as $26$ upon division by $12$. This remainder is $\boxed{2}$.
gpt_response:
Let the three integers be $a$, $b$, and $c$. We know that:

$a \equiv 7 \pmod{12}$
$b \equiv 9 \pmod{12}$
$c \equiv 10 \pmod{12}$

This means that $a=12k+7$, $b=12m+9$, and $c=12n+10$ for some integers $k$, $m$, and $n$.

The sum of the three integers is:
$a+b+c = (12k+7) + (12m+9) + (12n+10) = 12(k+m+n) + 26$

So when we divide the sum of the three integers by $12$, the remainder is $\boxed{2}$.

The sum of the three integers is:
$a+b+c = (12k+7) + (12m+9) + (12n+10) = 12(k+m+n) + 26$
